jibe.sdk.client.video
Class CameraMediaSource

java.lang.Object
  jibe.sdk.client.video.CameraMediaSource

public class CameraMediaSource
extends java.lang.Object

The media source for handling the Android camera. A client application needs an an instance of this class to the SDK, when sending live video.

The camera resolution defaults to QVGA (320x240) if supported by the hardware. If not, CIF or QCIF are used.

Field Detail

FRAMERATE_STEPS_CIF

public static final float[] FRAMERATE_STEPS_CIF
The video properties (size, frame rate, etc.). Number of steps needs to be equal to DreamVideo.NUM_BITRATE_ADAPTATION_STEPS.

CameraMediaSource

public CameraMediaSource(int cameraId,
                         SurfaceView localSurface)
Creates a new camera media-source.

Parameters:
cameraId - The ID of the camera to use ( CAMERA_FRONT, CAMERA_BACK).
localSurface - The surface on which to render a preview of the local video.

getDefaultCameraId

public static int getDefaultCameraId()
Returns CAMERA_FRONT or CAMERA_BACK depending on the device to account for handsets with only front cam (e.g. Nexus 7) or only back cam (e.g. HTC Desire)
